00098 
00099 void test_it()
00100 {
00101     if (os_) *os_ << "test_it()\n";
00102 
00103     double a = 10;
00104     for (double x=-a; x<=a; x+=a/100)
00105     {
00106         if (os_) *os_ << "a: " << a << endl;
00107         complex<double> resultComplex = erf(complex<double>(x));
00108         double resultReal = ((double(*)(double))erf)(x);
00109         if (os_) *os_ << resultComplex << " " << resultReal << endl;
00110         unit_assert_equal(resultComplex.real(), resultReal, 1e-12);
00111     }
00112 }
00113 
00114 void test_itvs2()
00115 {
00116     if (os_) *os_ << "test_itvs2()\n";
00117 
00118     // erf_series2 matches erf in region [-2,2]x[-2,2] within 1e-10
00119     double a = 2;
00120     for (double x=-a; x<=a; x+=a/5.)
00121     for (double y=-a; y<=a; y+=a/5.)
00122     {
00123         complex<double> z(x,y);
00124         complex<double> result1 = erf(z);
00125         complex<double> result2 = erf_series2(z);
00126         //if (os_) *os_ << z << ": " << abs(result1-result2) << endl;
00127         unit_assert_equal(abs(result1-result2), 0, 1e-10);
00128     }
00129 }
00130 
00131 
00132 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00133 {
00134     try
00135     {
00136         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00137         if (os_) *os_ << "erfTest\n" << setprecision(20);
00138         //test_it(); // msvc chokes on this for some reason -- fix if you're going to use this implementation
00139         test_itvs2();
00140         return 0;
00141     }
00142     catch (exception &e)
00143     {
00144         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00145         return 1;
00146     }
00147 }
